ast 37th Street, east of Second Avenue, showing

712389f-a.title: Manhattan: 37th Street - 2nd Avenue
712389f-a.text:
East 37th otreet, north side (buildings thereupon),
west Irom Second avenue, showing the Murray Hill Industrial
High School. the New York Telephone Co. building and the
Jarcho Brothers Aarehouse.
To the left of the latter appears the upper portion
of the dominant 1O E. 40th Street Building. Above the school
is the spired Chrysler Building.
The vacant lot shown at the S.W. corner will be
exeavated to provide the extrance site to the Midtown-Queens
Tunnel under thue East River. The Industrial High School was
formerly P. S. 49.
July 23, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIO11S

ay 26, 1939

712386f-a.title: Manhattan: 37th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712386f-a.text:
East 57th Street, east from Second Avenue. The
buildings on tne right will be cenmolisned for the Midtown
Oueens tunnel. This phase completed is shown in Views 2 and 3.
Note at the left the clearance at the N.E. corner.
This prcceIed the tunnel project and had nothing to do with
same. The New York Steam Co. plant appears on 33th Street,
between First AVenue and thhe East iver.
Demolition of St. Gabriel's Roman Gatholic Church
permitted tnis view and the steeple-less edifice is seen
(in View 1) slightly to the east of Second Avenue.
View 1: May 2t, 1939
Views 2-3 : June 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTINS

712384f-a.title: Manhattan: 37th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712384f-a.text:
E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing
at No. 308, St. Gabriel's Roman Catholio Church prior to demolition
(June 1939) as a portion of the clearance necessitated for the
approach to the 38th Street tunnel. The lower portion of this
block is already razed and the balance will shortly follow.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City TTunnel Authority
CREDIT LINiE I.PERATIVE

712401f-a.title: Manhattan: 37th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712401f-a.text:
E. 37th Street, west of Second Avenue, showing at the
left buildings that will be completely gone in July 1939.
This will extend to within 175 feet of Third Avenue and not
include the B. Altman warehouse. To the ri,ght margin is the
construction elevator necessitated by the New York Telephone Co.
building addition.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

712397f-c.title: Manhattan: 37th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712397f-c.text:
308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue, showing
the final stages of St. uabriel's Roman Catholic Church. This
parish, established in 1660 is being demolished in the execution
of plans for the plasa approach to the new Midtown Tunnel under
the East River. Note the Parochial school to the rear.
May, 1939
George D. Chinn
NO REPROOUCTAONS
(2) and (3)
Two westerly views of the same edifice slightly later.
Here the photographer is viewing towards Second Avenue. Note
in the distance the dimly outlined Empire State Building.
May 27, 1939
Views: 2 and 3
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

712381f-a.title: Manhattan: 37th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712381f-a.text:
East 37th Street, at Second Avenue, as photographed across
the plaza entrance to the Cueens-Midtown Tunnel. This is
south of the street; the buildings being on the north side
of same. Tha ''El'' line is upon the Avenue. In the back-
ground are the skyscrapers constituting the 42nd Street-
Grand Central zone. The photographer is viewing northwest-
ward from East 36th Street, and is standing almost on the
site of the former St. Gabriels R. C. Church and School.
October 11, 1939
September 21, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

712392f-a.title: Manhattan: 37th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712392f-a.text:
308 E. 37th Street, south side, east of Second Avenue.
A northward view down the center aisle of St. Gabriel's Roman
